metadata.title: CVE-2021-4287 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in ReFirmLabs binwalk up to 2.3.2. Affected is an unknown function of the filesrc/binwalk/modules/extractor.py of the component Archive ExtractionHandler. The manipulation leads to symlink following. It is possible tolaunch the attack remotely. Upgrading to version 2.3.3 is able to addressthis issue. The name of the patch isfa0c0bd59b8588814756942fe4cb5452e76c1dcd. It is recommended to upgrade theaffected component. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-216876.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binwalk - 2.3.3+dfsg1-2
python3-binwalk - 2.3.3+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binwalk package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.3+dfsg1-2').
